page.title: 10PLASHETT _ HISTORY
page.content: The 'Half way House' was a staging post between Lewes and Uckfield. The 'Old Ship' dates from the Sixteenth century and was a staging post for the barges which sailed up the River Ouse from Newhaven and Lewes. At that time the river was about eight feet wider than it is today. A butchers shop adjoined the Inn so that boats could also be provisioned here. A mummified cat, walled up, probably alive, in a sitting position, was found during recent rennovations and it is thought that it was put there to ward off evil spirits. The 'Anchor Inn' is also very old and was also used as a stopping place for river traffic
